intro: Heracleum yoshii, commonly known as Yoshii cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, umbrella-like compound leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces elongated, ribbed fruits. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and meadows.
